dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, welcome back everyone to "Market Movers," and uh, wow. Looking back at 2020, it was, like, an absolutely wild year for markets, wasn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, welcome back everyone to Market Movers, and uh, wow. Looking back at twenty twenty, it was, like, an absolutely wild year for markets, wasn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wild is an understatement, Host_A. I mean, there was unbelievable uncertainty for most of the year, but somehow, everyone on Wall Street, from billionaires to, uh, millennial day traders in their pajamas, got rich.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wild is an understatement, Host_A. I mean, there was unbelievable uncertainty for most of the year, but somehow, everyone on Wall Street, from billionaires to, uh, millennial day traders in their pajamas, got rich.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There was unbelievable uncertainty throughout most of the year, but amid it all, everyone on Wall Streetfrom billionaire investors to hidebound millennial day traders in their pajamasgot rich.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It dropped like a stone early in the pandemic, and then, boom, nearly 50% recovery in months. One of the fastest ever. And a lot of that, like, credit actually goes to millions of young quarantining day traders.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It dropped like a stone early in the pandemic, and then, boom, nearly fifty percent recovery in months. One of the fastest ever. And a lot of that, like, credit actually goes to millions of young quarantining day traders.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Financial markets dropped like a stone early in the Covid-19 crisis and then recovered nearly 50% in a span of months, one of the fastest rebounds ever seen. Millions of young quarantining day traders were behind the markets rise, often beating the professionals to buy the dip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the Robinhood crowd! They were, like, beating the pros to "buy the dip." It's pretty incredible. And, of course, thanks to government stimulus and cheap debt, corporations just gorged on financing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the Robinhood crowd! They were, like, beating the pros to buy the dip. It's pretty incredible. And, of course, thanks to government stimulus and cheap debt, corporations just gorged on financing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Millions of young quarantining day traders were behind the markets rise, often beating the professionals to buy the dip. Thanks to the governments accommodations, corporations gorged on cheap debt in 2020 to get past Covid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then the IPOs started humming! Like nothing since the Dot-Com bubble, right? But then, uh, the article says "the inmates took over the asylum."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then the I P Os started humming! Like nothing since the Dot-Com bubble, right? But then, uh, the article says the inmates took over the asylum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Once markets recovered, initial public offerings began to hum like nothing seen since the Dot-Com-bubble era. Then the inmates took over the asylum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] That's where the SPACs come in! Special Purpose Acquisition Companies. Once used by, like, shady folks, now they're taking electric vehicle companies, marijuana growers, even online gambling stocks public. And retail investors just bid them to the stratosphere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's where the S P A Cs come in! Special Purpose Acquisition Companies. Once used by, like, shady folks, now they're taking electric vehicle companies, marijuana growers, even online gambling stocks public. And retail investors just bid them to the stratosphere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A market for speculative IPOs, called SPACs, took shape so bankers could list electric vehicle companies, marijuana growers and online gambling stocks, which Robinhood traders would promptly bid to the stratosphere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, "crayon valuations," as the article put it. It's minting new billionaires, at least temporarily. Tesla alone gained half a trillion dollars!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, crayon valuations, as the article put it. It's minting new billionaires, at least temporarily. Tesla alone gained half a trillion dollars!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla gained about half a trillion dollars in value. ... Because of egregious fees and valuations written in crayon, the bubble will likely mint a dozen new billionaires, at least temporarily.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Insane. But, you know, it wasn't just the retail crowd. "Smart money" also had massive years. Take Baillie Gifford's Scottish Mortgage Trust, for example.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Insane. But, you know, it wasn't just the retail crowd. Smart money also had massive years. Take Baillie Gifford's Scottish Mortgage Trust, for example.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid it all, smart money was put to work, and big investors had enormous years. Here are our choices for the best firms and investors of 2020. Best Product: Baillie Giffords Scottish Mortgage Trust

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, SMT? Yeah, that thing's a bargain. Tiny fee, and they've got stakes in Tesla, Amazon, Tencent, *and* private companies like SpaceX and Stripe. Up 400% in five years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, S M T? Yeah, that thing's a bargain. Tiny fee, and they've got stakes in Tesla, Amazon, Tencent, and private companies like SpaceX and Stripe. Up four hundred percent in five years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For a 0.36% fee, you get a portfolio of stocks... Its investments in Tesla, Amazon, Tencent and a few dozen high-growth stocks have propelled it to a 400% gain over the past five years. The trust also holds nearly 20% of its assets in private companies such as Ant Financial, SpaceX, Stripe...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Blackstone too, right? Led by Stephen Schwarzman, they're outperforming by investing in logistics, life sciences real estate, and companies like Bumble.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Blackstone too, right? Led by Stephen Schwarzman, they're outperforming by investing in logistics, life sciences real estate, and companies like Bumble.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Outstanding Firm: Blackstone Led by billionaires Stephen Schwarzman and Jonathan Gray, Blackstone is outperforming peers by dint of its investments in logistics and life sciences real estate and its bets on businesses like Tradeweb, Paysafe, Oatly, Bumble and buyout firm BC Partners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or Orlando Bravo. Remember Thoma Bravo bought Ellie Mae, a mortgage software firm, for $3.7 billion? Housing market goes bonkers, and he sold it for a $9 billion profit. Just, uh, mind-boggling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or Orlando Bravo. Remember Thoma Bravo bought Ellie Mae, a mortgage software firm, for three point seven billion dollars? Housing market goes bonkers, and he sold it for a nine billion dollar profit. Just, uh, mind-boggling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Top Deal: Orlando Bravo Two years ago, billionaire Orlando Bravos technology buyout firm Thoma Bravo paid $3.7 billion to take mortgage software firm Ellie Mae private during a brief slowdown in the housing market. Now, the real estate market is going bonkers, and Thoma Bravo minted a $9 billion profit selling the business to the parent company of the New York Stock Exchange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And speaking of amazing performances, we can't end without talking about Forbes's Finance and Investing Person of the Year: Cathie Wood.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And speaking of amazing performances, we can't end without talking about Forbes's Finance and Investing Person of the Year: Cathie Wood.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And drumroll, please The Forbes Finance & Investing Person Of The Year: Cathie Wood, Founder, Ark Invest

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Ark Invest! Her ETFs are just... unbelievable. The flagship Ark Innovation ETF was up 150% year-to-date. She's really disrupted traditional investing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Ark Invest! Her E T Fs are just... unbelievable. The flagship Ark Innovation E T F was up one hundred fifty percent year-to-date. She's really disrupted traditional investing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her flagship Ark Innovation ETF is up 150% year-to-date, and assets have surged to $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, assets surged to $15 billion for that one. So, looking ahead, what's the forecast? "The Biden Bull Market?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, assets surged to fifteen billion dollars for that one. So, looking ahead, what's the forecast? The Biden Bull Market?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her flagship Ark Innovation ETF is up 150% year-to-date, and assets have surged to $15 billion. ... Forbes Forecast: The Biden Bull Market

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what Forbes says. Rock-bottom interest rates, strong household balance sheets, and the eventual reopening of America, all giving tailwinds. Plus, companies that thrived in the pandemic, like Apple and Zoom, should keep gaining.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what Forbes says. Rock-bottom interest rates, strong household balance sheets, and the eventual reopening of America, all giving tailwinds. Plus, companies that thrived in the pandemic, like Apple and Zoom, should keep gaining.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stars are lining up for a prolonged bull market as rock-bottom interest rates, strong household balance sheets and the eventual reopening of America give tailwinds to the economy and financial markets. Even better, the companies that benefited from changes accelerated by the pandemic, like Apple, Zoom, Microsoft, Amazon, Prologis and Verizon, should see gains for years to come.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, it sounds like 2020 set the stage for potentially more wealth creation in the years to come, despite all the, uh, initial craziness.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it sounds like twenty twenty set the stage for potentially more wealth creation in the years to come, despite all the, uh, initial craziness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It was a year of paradox, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It was a year of paradox, that's for sure.
